subject: Add the ability to specify the sort dir for each key

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

messages.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The API WG is discussing a relevant recommendation https://review.openstack.org/#/c/145579/ and Steven Kaufer has talked about updating other projects this cycle to include the recommendations. At this point it might be good to consider supporting it for this use case. Please note that this new sorting syntax will match the cli syntax that glanceclient will need to implement (and was discussed as a cross-project spec).

Patch Set 1:

Merge Failed.

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.

Patch Set 1:

Hello, Ian.Thanks for your remark.
Actually new sorting syntax from your postlink is implemented in another commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148512/.
This one only adds new functionality without changing the existing syntax.

Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Mike I just reviewed that. I'm going to take a second look through this and then I'll update with a proper CR. :D

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

A couple of concerns and nits. I'm really not sure how to handle the lambda you're defining. If we were on Python 3, a simple 'nonlocal key' would satisfy me but that's invalid syntax on Py2.

(4 comments)

(7 comments)

Uploaded patch set 7.
Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased

Patch Set 6:

(7 comments)

Hello! I correct almost all of your remarks, see my comments to the previous patchset.

Also I decided to rethink the conception of multiple dirs - now it's always a list, like how it's done with sort keys.

For now big part of the code is changing in tests to convert strings to lists. Also I fixed several issues with lists as default parameters.

Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

These changes look good, but they don't seem to work with multiple --sort-dir flags. On a devstack with the latest patchset of both this change and Ia20716f3c75299f796879299da317b2e81496088, I get:

    $ glance --os-image-api-version 2 image-list --sort-key size --sort-dir asc --sort-key name
    +--------------------------------------+---------------------------------+
    | ID                                   | Name                            |
    +--------------------------------------+---------------------------------+
    | 57b03c7a-09ca-48f9-b26c-72236139e93b | cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-uec-ramdisk |
    | 9e853f88-1555-482e-892c-59c5529e575e | cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-uec-kernel  |
    | c1e861c7-0c16-4ab9-bdae-a3ba39493baf | cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-uec         |
    +--------------------------------------+---------------------------------+
    $ glance --os-image-api-version 2 image-list --sort-key size --sort-dir asc --sort-key name --sort-dir asc
    +----+------+
    | ID | Name |
    +----+------+
    +----+------+

Patch Set 8:

Sorry, but for me everything works fine. I checked out the last versions of server and client commits and got a correct output.

See my paste from devstack: http://paste.openstack.org/show/191903/

Patch Set 8:

Mike, I think to settle the matter you should write a covering test for it.

Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

Started fresh with a clean devstack VM and it worked, so it must have just been some old devstack cruft.
